answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Ben, 
Unfortunately at this time there are no RFPs for downtown overlay districts on the Knowledge Network. However we do have a previously asked question which contains documents and information about creating downtown overlay districts and and some example market study plans that may be useful to you as you develop your RFP. 
-Previously asked question on market studies http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/22664
-Previously asked question on downtown overlay districts http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/22825
I hope other local government officials are able to chime in and provide you with more specific RFP examples. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Ben Boike
text:
The City of West St. Paul, MN is looking to hire a consultant through a Request for Qualifications (RFQ) process to develop several commercial overlay districts specifically addressing design standards.  If you have an example of a recent RFQ or RFP for something similar, it would be extremely helpful if you can share it.  We are looking at possibly advertising it nationally rather than just local.
West St. Paul is a first tier suburb of Mpls/St. Paul with a 2.5 mile commercial corridor with three different types of commercial development (result of hsitorical development patterns).  The goal is to create three overlay districts with specific design standards based on the different characteristics of each area.
Any help would be appreciated.
Thanks,
Ben Boike
City Planner
West St. Paul, MN
651-552-4134
title: RFQ Examples - creation of commercial overlay districts
